item.title: Promise Mascot Agency ‘Prepare to Grind’ update now available
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

New truck upgrade, mascot time trials, Pinky nails, Mascot Support Heroes, and more.

Kaizen Game Works has released the “Prepare to Grind” update for “open-world mascot management crime drama” game Promise Mascot Agency, the developer announced. It adds a new truck upgrade, mascot time trials, Pinky nails, Mascot Support Heroes, and more

Here is an overview of the update, via Kaizen Game Works:

“Prepare to Grind” Update

  • There is now an extra truck upgrade that allows you to grind on rails and train tracks. After unlocking it, jump at a metal fence or train track, and press INTERACT to grind (you can find the upgrade fox near the abandoned village).
  • Time Trials have been added. There are ten to complete. Achieving par times unlocks new hero cards. Time Trials are unlocked after speaking to Shiori at the stage outside the agency and recruiting specific mascots. The options menu contains a difficulty setting for the Time Trials.
  • Difficulty modes have been added. You can change the difficulty when starting a new game and at any time in the Options menu. The difficulty mode only affects sending money to Matriarch Shimazu (this feature unlocks part way through the game).
  • Added a lot of new hero cards that can be acquired from Captain Sign, the new Kaso-Mart stores and the new Time Trials. These cards include collaboration with Hot Indie Bangers, including Unbeatable, Sorry We’re Closed, Paradise Killer and Dunk Dunk.
  • All Kaso Marts can now be interacted with! Drive up to the door and see what’s in store.
  • The vocals version of the music track “Promises Lost (Promises Found)” is now available for purchase from Captain Sign.
  • New seasonal props have been added for Halloween, Christmas, Children’s Day and Obon.
  • A lot more Pinky nails have been added. Some will appear in the world after a mascot has been recruited, others need to be unlocked from Captain Sign.
  • You can now change the style of the button prompts between different controller types (Xbox Series, PlayStation 5, Switch). PC ONLY!
  • Music track skip enabled on controller (R3 by default). Keyboard still supports previous track (1 on keyboard) and next track (2 on keyboard).

Bug Fixes and Improvements

  • Crane game;
    • Sped up the action.
    • Improved readability of crane game assets.
  • Improved max stamina rewards from mascot Life Satisfaction events.
  • Fixed issue with Neko-Roll giving you infinite items.
  • Fixed issues around not seeing characters in a certain mascot’s Life Satisfaction events.
  • Fixed broken logic around Kannushi-kun’s Town Quest.
  • Audio fixes and improvements.
  • Setting deadzone to 100% no longer hard locks the game.
  • Adding option to choose controller icon type (PC Only).
  • User interface improvements and bug fixes.
  • Adding Y-FOV option.
  • Fixed potential softlock under certain conditions in dialogue user interface.
  • Added option to toggle Pinky Launcher icons on and off.
  • Fixed arcade games appearing at the game center before you have delivered them.
  • Added some controller prompts to assist with gliding.
  • Increased difficulty of Medium and Hard difficulty mascot battles to make more use of hero cards, and provide a more engaging experience
  • Altered the map visibility thresholds for the smashed billboards and litter collection to 95% (were 97%), and the katashiro to 93% (was 96%).
  • Fixed issues with some achievements not being given, and attempting to retroactively award those achievements.

Promise Mascot Agency is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: ACA NEOGEO Selection Vol. 7 and 8 announced for Switch
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Due out on November 6 in Japan.

SNK has announced ACA NEOGEO Selection Vol. 7 and ACA NEOGEO Selection Vol. 8 for Switch. Both will launch on November 6 in Japan for 5,940 yen each. Each collection includes 10 games previously released digitally as ACA NEOGEO titles.

The included titles are as follows:

  • ACA NEOGEO Selection Vol. 7
    • Fatal Fury Special
    • The King of Fighters 2003
    • King of the Monsters 2
    • Metal Slug 5
    • Pleasure Goal: 5 on 5 Mini Soccer
    • Power Spikes II
    • Prehistoric Isle 2
    • Puzzle Bobble
    • World Heroes 2
    • ZuPaPa!
  • ACA NEOGEO Selection Vol. 8
    • Art of Fighting
    • Blue’s Journey
    • Crossed Swords
    • The King of Fighters ’99
    • Kizuna Encounter: Super Tag Battle
    • Metal Slug 2
    • NAM-1975
    • Puzzle Bobble 2
    • Super Sidekicks 2
    • World Heroes 2 Jet

Collections one and two launched on December 12, 2024 in Japan, followed by three and four on April 10, 2025, and five and six today.
